name: Zapiekanki

SautÃ© onion in butter and oil, add mushrooms, cook until liquid evaporates.

Split baguettes lengthwise, spread mushroom mix, top with cheeses, ham and kabanos, bake 8â10 min.
Top with caramelised onions, dill, chives and ketchup.

name: Osso Buco alla Milanese
steps: Preheat oven to 150Â°C (300Â°F).
Season shanks, dredge in flour, shake excess.
Brown shanks in oil and 1 tbsp butter. Remove.
Discard fat, add remaining butter. Cook onion, carrot, celery, fennel 6 min.
Add garlic, orange zest, marjoram, bay leaf. Cook 1â2 min.
Add wine, boil and reduce by half. Add stock and tomatoes. Reduce to 1 cup.
Return shanks, cover with parchment touching meat, then lid. Braise 2 hours, turning once.
Mix gremolata (parsley, garlic, lemon zest).
Sprinkle half gremolata, return to oven 15 min uncovered.
Remove shanks carefully.
Reduce sauce if needed, adjust seasoning with remaining gremolata.
Serve shanks with sauce and risotto.

name: Oxtail with Broad Beans

Brown oxtail in oil for 10 minutes.
Transfer to pressure cooker with 375ml water. Cook 25 minutes.
Add broad beans, simmer until tender.
Add cornflour slurry to thicken the sauce.
Cook until beans soft and sauce thick.

name: Oyster Soup
steps: Strain oysters, reserve liquid.
Heat milk in pan but do not boil.
Add butter, salt and paprika.
Add oysters and their liquid.
Cook until edges of oysters curl.
Serve hot, sprinkled with parsley.

name: Oysters Rockefeller

Add spinach, cook until wilted.
Add breadcrumbs, salt and pepper.
Arrange oysters in shells on baking sheet.
Top each oyster with spinach mixture.
Bake until topping is golden.
Serve immediately.

name: Oliebollen
steps: Mix flour and sugar in a large bowl.
Dissolve yeast in warm water, add eggs and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients into a thick batter.
Fold in diced apples, raisins and cinnamon.
Cover and let rise until doubled.
Heat oil to 180Â°C.
Use two spoons to drop batter balls into the oil.
Fry until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and dust with powdered sugar.

name: Nanaimo Bars
steps: Melt butter with sugar and cocoa over bain-marie. Whisk in egg until thick.
Add biscuit crumbs, coconut and almonds. Press into tin. Chill 10 min.
Beat butter, cream and custard powder. Add icing sugar. Spread over base.
Melt chocolate and butter. Pour over custard layer. Chill 2 hours.
Cut into squares.

name: Nasi Lemak
steps: Cook rice with coconut milk, ginger, salt and bay leaf until done.
Boil eggs 10â12 min, cool and slice. Slice cucumber.
Fry peanuts until golden. Fry anchovies until crisp. Drain on paper.
Fry onion, garlic and shallots. Add chilli paste and cook 10 min, add water if dry.
Add anchovies, salt, sugar and tamarind. Simmer until thick.
Serve rice with sambal, peanuts, anchovies, cucumber and eggs.

name: New York Cheesecake
steps: Make "crust": mix butter, crumbs and sugar. Press into tin. Bake 10 min.
Beat cream cheese until creamy. Add sugar, flour and salt.
Add vanilla, lemon zest, juice, then eggs one by one. Mix sour cream in.
Pour filling, bake 10 min at high heat. Reduce heat, bake 25 min.
Cool in oven 2 hours. Mix topping (sour cream, sugar, lemon). Spread.
Chill overnight. Remove from tin.

name: Noodle Bowl Salad
steps: Soak noodles in boiling water with sugar snap peas for 4 min.
Drain, rinse under cold water, drain again, toss with sesame oil.
Prepare "dressing": soy sauce, honey, lemon juice, oil, garlic, ginger.
Add spring onions, coriander and salmon to noodles.
Pour dressing and toss. Serve with pretzels or bread roll.

name: Nordic SmÃ¸rrebrÃ¸d with Asparagus & Horseradish Cream
steps: Mix crÃ¨me fraÃ®che, horseradish, lemon, salt and pepper. Chill.
Fry sliced shallots until crisp, drain on paper.
Blanch half the asparagus, cool in ice water. Slice remaining asparagus raw.
Grill buttered rye bread until golden.
Assemble: bread â asparagus (raw + blanched) â horseradish cream â cheese â crispy shallots â dill.

name: Norwegian Krumkake
steps: Whisk eggs and sugar until thick.
Add melted butter, spices and flour to form batter.
Rest 30 minutes.
Bake spoonfuls of batter on krumkake iron.
While hot, roll over cone or cup. Cool until crisp.
Store in tin or freeze.

name: Norwegian Potato Lefse
steps: Boil potatoes, peel while warm, rice twice.
Cool uncovered in fridge.
Add salt, sugar, melted butter and cream.
Add flour gradually and knead until soft dough forms.
Divide dough into 7â8 balls (large griddle) or 10â12 (small pan).
Shape balls into flat discs without cracks.
Roll thin on floured surface.
Cook on hot griddle, flip when brown spots appear.
Store finished lefse in damp folded cloth.

name: Nutty Chicken Curry
steps: Blend chilli, ginger, garlic, coriander stalks and some leaves into paste.
Brown chicken 1 minute in oil.
Add paste, cook 1 minute.
Add peanut butter, stock and yogurt. Simmer 10 minutes.
Stir in coriander leaves before serving.
Serve with rice or mashed sweet potato.

name: Ma Po Tofu
steps: Add a small pinch of salt and sesame oil to minced beef. Mix well and set aside.
Mix 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 2 and Â½ tablespoons of water in a small bowl to make water starch.
Cut tofu into square cubes (around 2cms). Bring a large amount of water to a boil and then add a pinch of salt. Slide the tofu in and cook for 1 minute. Move out and drain.
Get a wok and heat up around 2 tablespoons of oil, fry the minced meat until crispy. Transfer out beef out and leave the oil in.
Fry doubanjiang for 1 minute over slow fire and then add garlic, scallion white, ginger and fermented black beans to cook for 30 seconds until aroma. Then mix pepper flakes in.

Add water to the seasonings and bring to boil over high fire. Gently slide the tofu cubes. Add light soy sauce and beef.Slow the heat after boiling and then simmer for 6-8 minutes. Then add chopped garlic greens.

Stir the water starch and then pour half of the mixture to the simmering pot. Wait for around 30 seconds and then pour the other half. You can slightly taste the tofu and add pinch of salt if not salty enough. By the way, if you feel it is too spicy, add some sugar can milder the taste. But be carefully as the broth is very hot at this point.
Transfer out when almost all the seasonings stick to tofu cubes. Sprinkle Szechuan peppercorn powder (to taste)and chopped garlic greens if using.
Serve immediately with steamed rice.

name: Madeira Cake
steps: Pre-heat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Grease an 18cm/7in round cake tin, line the base with greaseproof paper and grease the paper.

Cream the butter and sugar together in a bowl until pale and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, beating the mixture well between each one and adding a tablespoon of the flour with the last egg to prevent the mixture curdling.
Sift the flour and gently fold in, with enough milk to give a mixture that falls slowly from the spoon. Fold in the lemon zest.

Spoon the mixture into the prepared tin and lightly level the top. Bake on the middle shelf of the oven for 30-40 minutes, or until golden-brown on top and a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and set aside to cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn it out on to a wire rack and leave to cool completely.
To serve, decorate the cake with the candied peel.

name: Mamoul (Eid Biscuits)
steps: Cream butter with sugar.
Add oil, flour and semolina.
Add warm milk and mix lightly.
Rest 1 hour.
Prepare date filling with sesame, butter and paste.
Shape 15g date balls and chill.
Shape 30g dough balls and fill with dates.
Press into mamoul mould.
Bake at 180Â°C for 20 min until golden.

name: Massaman Beef Curry
steps: Roast peanuts until golden and chop.
Heat coconut cream, fry curry paste, add beef and coat well.
Add remaining coconut cream, water, potatoes, onion, lime leaves, cinnamon, tamarind, sugar, fish sauce and peanuts.
Simmer covered for 2 hours until beef is tender.
Top with chilli and remaining peanuts.
Serve with jasmine rice.

name: Matambre a la Pizza
steps: Season matambre with salt and pepper.
Grill one side until half-cooked.
Flip and top with tomato sauce, mozzarella, oregano and olives.
Continue grilling until cheese melts.
Slice and serve.

name: Matar Paneer
steps: Fry paneer pieces until golden, remove.
Fry ginger, cumin, turmeric, coriander and chilli 1 min.
Add tomatoes, mash and simmer 5 min.
Add peas and simmer 2 min.
Return paneer, add garam masala, mix.
Serve with coriander and naan or rice.

name: Mazariner â Scandinavian Almond Tartlets
steps: Mix flour and powdered sugar. Add butter, pulse, then add egg to form dough.
Roll out dough, cut circles, line muffin tin. Chill.
Prepare almond "filling": whisk eggs and sugar until thick, add melted butter, vanilla, flour, almond extract, and almond flour.
Fill shells and bake 20â25 min at 180Â°C.
Prepare glaze by mixing powdered sugar and cream.
Spread glaze on cooled tartlets.

name: Mbuzi Choma (Roasted Goat)
steps: Roast goat meat for about 50 minutes, salting while turning.
Boil water and salt, add cornmeal slowly to make ugali.
Cook, stir, and form firm dough. Cool slightly and shape.
Prepare "kachumbari": mix tomatoes, onions, chilli and coriander.
Serve meat with ugali and kachumbari.

name: McSinghs Scotch Pie
steps: Toast cumin seeds, set aside. Fry onions, garlic, chilli and pepper until dry.
Add toasted cumin, nutmeg, coriander. Cool.
Mix lamb, pepper, fresh coriander and onion mixture.
Make pastry with flour, salt, hot milk, lard and water.
Line tin with pastry, add filling, cover with pastry lid.
Brush with egg yolk, bake 30 min at 200Â°C, then 1h15 at 160Â°C.
Cool completely before slicing.

name: Mediterranean Pasta Salad
ingredients: Extra Virgin Olive Oil â 3 tbsp
steps: Boil salted water and cook pasta 10 minutes.
Wash tomatoes, cut into quarters. Slice olives. Prepare basil.
Mix tomatoes with basil and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Drain pasta and cool under cold water.
Combine pasta with tomatoes, basil, olives, mozzarella and tuna.
Let rest 30 minutes for flavours to blend.
Season with pepper and remaining olive oil before serving.

name: Mee Goreng Mamak
steps: Fry peanuts, dried chillies, dried shrimps and dhal until fragrant. Blend with tamarind and water into paste.
Cook paste in oil until it darkens and separates.
Boil potato chunks until tender, set aside.
Slice onion, tofu, cabbage and Chinese broccoli. Prepare noodles.
For each portion, fry garlic, onion and paste. Add prawns if desired.
Add tofu, potatoes, cabbage and broccoli. Toss.
Add noodles, dark soy mixture and stir 1 minute.
Push noodles aside, cook egg, mix and garnish with lime and chillies.

name: Migas
steps: Crumble the bread, sprinkle with water, cover and rest 30 minutes.
Heat olive oil and fry garlic cloves with a cut in them. Remove garlic.
Fry moistened bread in the same oil, stirring 15 minutes.
Add garlic back, cook another 20 minutes until soft and golden.

name: Milanesa
steps: Season beef cutlets with salt and pepper.
Dip each cutlet in beaten eggs.
Coat with breadcrumbs mixed with parsley and garlic.
Fry in hot oil 3â4 minutes per side until golden.
Serve with lemon wedges or salad.

name: Mince Pies
steps: Rub butter into flour, mix in sugar and salt to form firm dough.
Chill or use immediately.
Preheat oven to 200Â°C.
Press dough balls into patty tin holes.
Fill with mincemeat.
Top with pastry lids and seal.
Brush with beaten egg, bake 20 minutes.
Cool and dust with icing sugar.

name: Minced Beef Pie
steps: Heat oil and brown mince 4â5 min.
Add onion, cook 2 min, add tomato purÃ©e and cook 2â3 min.
Stir in flour, then mushrooms, stock and Worcestershire sauce.
Simmer 20 min, cool, then place filling in pie dish.
Roll pastry, cover pie, seal and decorate.
Cut vents, brush with egg yolk.
Bake 20â25 min at 200Â°C until golden.

name: Mini Chilli Beef Pies
steps: Fry onion in oil, add spices, then beef. Add purÃ©e, stock and cinnamon. Simmer 15â20 min, add beans.
Bake pastry cases 10 min at 200Â°C.
Boil and mash potato with sour cream and chives.
Fill pastry with chilli mix, top with mash, bake 15 min until golden.

name: Montreal Smoked Meat
steps: Mix cure ingredients and rub all over brisket. Cure 4 days in fridge, flipping daily.
Rinse cure, soak brisket 2 hours, changing water every 30 min.
Rub with pepper, coriander, paprika, garlic, onion, dill, mustard and celery seed.
Smoke at 225Â°F until internal temp reaches 165Â°F.
Steam brisket 1â2 hours until 180Â°F.
Slice and serve on rye with mustard.

name: Moroccan Carrot Soup
steps: Preheat oven to 180Â°C.
Mix carrots, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt and olive oil. Spread on tray.
Roast 10â12 min until softened.
Blend roasted mix with water until smooth, strain.
Heat soup, add 2 cups water, bring to boil.
Add garam masala, simmer, finish with lemon juice.
Serve hot.

name: Moussaka
steps: Brown beef 5 min in deep pan.
Microwave aubergine 3â5 min until soft.
Mix yogurt, egg and parmesan.
Add tomatoes, purÃ©e and potatoes to beef. Season and heat.
Slice aubergine, place on top, cover with yogurt mixture.
Grill until golden.

name: Mulukhiyah
steps: SautÃ© onions in olive oil.
Add beef cubes, sear 3â4 min each side.
Add water to cover and cook until beef is done.
Add mulukhiyah and stir until thawed and boiling.
In separate pan, fry garlic in olive oil until fragrant.
Add garlic mixture to soup, simmer 5â10 min.
Salt to taste, serve with lemon and rice or pita.

name: Mushroom & Chestnut Rotolo
steps: Soak dried mushrooms. Blend most chestnuts with water into cream.
Fry shallots, garlic, chopped chestnuts and rosemary. Add wild mushrooms and soaked mushrooms.
Add soy sauce and cook. Add wine, mushroom liquid and chestnut cream to form sauce.
Blanch lasagne sheets 2 min, cool.
Spread sauce on sheets, roll, cut and place upright in dish.
Pour remaining sauce over, bake 10 min.
Top with breadcrumbs and sage, bake 10 min more.
Rest 10 min, drizzle truffle oil.

name: Mushroom Soup with Buckwheat
steps: Soak dried mushrooms in boiling water 20 minutes.
Boil mushrooms with their water, add bay leaf and allspice.
Cook buckwheat separately.
Fry chopped onion and carrot in butter until soft.
Add vegetables to soup, simmer 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve soup over cooked buckwheat, finish with cream and parsley.

name: Mustard Champ
steps: Boil potatoes until soft, drain and mash.
Heat butter and milk, stir into mash.
Add chopped spring onions, mustard, salt and pepper.
Beat until smooth and creamy.
Serve warm as classic Irish side dish.

name: Mutabbaq
steps: Chop spring onions, parsley and tomato. Mix with egg, beef, salt, pepper and curry.
Prepare soft dough with flour and water.
Roll dough thin, place filling in centre and fold.
Fry in oil until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot as traditional Yemeni street dish.

name: Laksa King Prawn Noodles
steps: Heat the oil in a large pan and fry the chilli for 1-2 mins until fragrant.
Stir in the curry paste and crumble in the stock cube. Cook for 1 min, then add the boiling water and coconut milk. Simmer for 5 mins.
Add the prawns and cook for a few mins until pink and cooked through.
Divide noodles and beansprouts between bowls, pour over the soup, then top with coriander and serve with lime wedges.

name: Lamb & apricot meatballs
steps: Heat some of the oil in a pan and cook the onion until soft.
Add garlic, lamb, apricots and spices, and cook until the lamb is browned.
Pour in the passata, season and simmer gently until the sauce is thickened and the meatballs are cooked through.

name: Lamb and Lemon Souvlaki
steps: Combine lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper.
Marinate lamb pieces in the mixture for at least 1 hour.
Thread lamb onto skewers and grill or barbecue until browned outside and cooked to your liking.

name: Lamb and Potato Pie
steps: Brown lamb with onion and carrots in a pan.
Add peas and stock (and Worcestershire sauce if using) and simmer until meat is tender and the sauce has reduced.
Boil potatoes until soft, then mash with butter and milk.
Put lamb mixture into an oven dish, top with mash and bake until golden.

name: Lamb Biryani
steps: Marinate lamb with yoghurt, garlic, ginger and spices.
Fry sliced onions in ghee until golden and crisp; set some aside.
Parboil rice until almost cooked and drain.
Layer lamb, rice, herbs and fried onions in a pot.
Cover tightly and cook on low heat until lamb is tender and rice is fully cooked (dum method).

name: Lamb Pilaf (Plov)
steps: Brown lamb in hot oil or fat.
Add onions and carrots and fry until lightly coloured.
Season with cumin, salt and pepper.
Add rice on top without stirring, then pour in hot water to just cover.
Cook on low heat until water is absorbed and rice is tender; let rest before serving.

name: Lamb Rogan Josh
steps: Fry onions until deep golden.
Add garlic and ginger, then lamb and brown on all sides.
Stir in spices and yoghurt, then add tomatoes or puree.
Simmer gently until lamb is tender and sauce is thick and aromatic.

name: Lamb Tajine
steps: Heat oil and brown lamb on all sides, then remove.
Cook onion and garlic until soft.
Add spices and stir briefly, then return lamb and add dried fruit and stock.
Simmer gently until lamb is tender and sauce is rich.

name: Lamb tomato and sweet spices
steps: Heat oil, brown the lamb then remove.
Soften onions and garlic in the same pan.
Add tomatoes, spices and honey, then return lamb.
Simmer until meat is tender and sauce thick.

name: Lamb Tzatziki Burgers
steps: Mix lamb mince with garlic, spices, onion, salt and pepper.
Form into burgers.
Grill or pan-fry until cooked through.
Serve in buns with tzatziki, lettuce and tomato.

name: Lamingtons
steps: Cream butter and sugar until light.
Beat in eggs, then fold in flour and milk.
Bake in a rectangular tin and cool.
Cut into squares, dip in chocolate icing, then roll in coconut.

name: Lancashire hotpot
steps: Layer lamb, onions and carrots in a casserole dish.
Pour over stock and season.
Top with overlapping slices of potato, brush with melted butter.
Bake until the potatoes are golden and the lamb is tender.

name: Lasagna
steps: Cook onion and garlic in oil, add beef and brown.
Add passata, season and simmer.
Layer sauce, pasta sheets and bÃ©chamel in a baking dish, repeating.
Top with cheese and bake until golden and bubbling.

name: Lasagne
steps: Make a ragÃ¹ by frying vegetables in oil, browning the meat, then adding wine and passata and simmering.
Layer ragÃ¹, pasta and bÃ©chamel in a dish.
Top with parmesan and bake until golden.

name: Leblebi Soup
steps: Heat chickpeas in their cooking liquid with garlic and spices.
Toast bread and place in bowls.
Crack an egg into each bowl.
Pour hot chickpea soup over to cook the egg slightly and serve.

name: Lemongrass Beef Noodles
steps: Put the ginger, garlic, lemongrass, coriander and 1 chilli in a food processor and blitz to a paste.
Heat oil in a pan, fry the paste, add beef, fish sauce, sugar and stock, then simmer until beef is tender.
Prepare noodles following pack instructions, then serve the beef mix over noodles with extra chilli and coriander, and lime wedges.

name: Locro
steps: Soak: Soak corn and beans overnight in water.
Cook "Meats": In a large pot, brown the beef and pork. Add onions and spices, cooking until translucent.
Simmer the "Stew": Add soaked corn and beans, pumpkin, potatoes and enough water to cover. Simmer for 2-3 hours, until thick.
Serve: Enjoy hot, with bread on the side.
Pro "Tips":
Toasting the corn slightly before adding it to the stew enhances its flavor.
Add a spoonful of paprika or a dash of cumin for an extra layer of warmth and complexity

name: kabse
steps: Caramelize the chicken with olive oil then add a maggi cube and boil it for around 30 minutes.
In another pot, add all the veggies and caramelize them till they are soft.
Once everything is done, add the rice, raisins & spices to the veggies and add 2 and a half cups of water for the rice to cook.
Once the rice is done put everything in the oven.

name: Kafteji
steps: Peel potatoes and cut into 5cm cubes.
Pour 1-2 cm of olive oil into a large pan and heat up very hot. Fry potatoes until golden brown for 20 minutes, turning from time to time. Place on kitchen paper to drain.

Cut the peppers in half and remove seeds. Rub a little olive oil on them and place the cut side down on a baking tray. Place them under the grill. Grill until the skin is dark and bubbly. While the peppers are still hot, put them into a plastic sandwich bag and seal it. Take them out after 15 minutes and remove skins.
In the meantime, heat more olive oil another pan. Peel the onions and cut into thin rings. Fry for 15 minutes until golden brown, turning them often. Add the Ras el hanout at the end.
Cut the pumpkin into 5cm cubes and fry in the same pan you used for the potatoes for 10-15 minutes until it is soft and slightly browned. Place on kitchen paper.

Pour the remaining olive oil out of the pan and put all the cooked vegetables into the pan and mix. Whisk eggs and pour them over the vegetables. Put the lid on the pan so that the eggs cook. Put the contents of the pan onto a large chopping board, add salt and pepper and chopped and mix everything with a big knife.

name: Kapsalon
steps: Cut the meat into strips. Heat oil in a pan and fry the strips for 6 minutes until it's ready.
Bake the fries until golden brown in a deep fryrer. When ready transfer to a backing dish. Make sure the fries are spread over the whole dish.
Cover the fries with a new layer of meat and spread evenly.
Add a layer of cheese over the meat. You can also use grated cheese. When done put in the oven for a few minutes until the cheese is melted.
Chop the lettuce, tomato and cucumber in small pieces and mix together. for a basic salad. As extra you can add olives jalapenos and a red union.
Dived the salad over the dish and Serve with garlicsauce and hot sauce

name: Karbonader (Lean Beef Patties) with Caramelized Onions
steps: Grate half an onion and set aside. Slice the rest of the onions and fry in butter on low/medium heat until caramelized.
In a bowl, mix together ground beef, grated onion, salt, pepper, nutmeg, potato/corn starch, and water.
Form into a sausage and cut 6 patties. Using a knife make a light grid pattern in each patty.
Brown both sides of the karbonader in butter on high heat, then turn down to low heat and fry for another 2 â 3 minutes.
Serve the karbonader and onions with potatoes, stewed peas, and brown sauce for dinner, or on a slice of bread for lunch or a snack.

name: Katsu Chicken curry
steps: Prep:15min  âº  "Cook":30min  âº  Ready "in":45min
For the curry "sauce": Heat oil in medium non-stick saucepan, add onion and garlic and cook until softened. Stir in carrots and cook over low heat for 10 to 12 minutes.
Add flour and curry powder; cook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in stock until combined; add honey, soy sauce and bay leaf. Slowly bring to the boil.

Turn down heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until sauce thickens but is still of pouring consistency. Stir in garam masala. Pour the curry sauce through a sieve; return to saucepan and keep on low heat until ready to serve.

For the "chicken": Season both sides of chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Place flour, egg and breadcrumbs in separate bowls and arrange in a row. Coat the chicken breasts in flour, then dip them into the egg, then coat in breadcrumbs, making sure you cover both sides.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium-high heat. Place chicken into hot oil and cook until golden brown, about 3 or 4 minutes each side. Once cooked, place on kitchen paper to absorb excess oil.
Pour curry sauce over chicken, serve with white rice and enjoy!

name: Kedgeree
steps: For the rice, heat the oil in a large, lidded pan, add the onion, then gently fry for 5 mins until softened but not coloured. Add the spices, season with salt, then continue to fry until the mix start to go brown and fragrant; about 3 mins.

Add the rice and stir in well. Add 600ml water, stir, then bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, then cover for 10 mins. Take off the heat and leave to stand, covered, for 10-15 mins more. The rice will be perfectly cooked if you do not lift the lid before the end of the cooking.

Meanwhile, put the haddock and bay leaves in a frying pan, cover with the milk, then poach for 10 mins until the flesh flakes. Remove from the milk, peel away the skin, then flake the flesh into thumbsize pieces. Place the eggs in a pan, cover with water, bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer. Leave for 4Â½-5 mins, plunge into cold water, then peel and cut the eggs into quarters. Gently mix the fish, eggs, parsley, coriander and rice together in the pan. Serve hot, sprinkled with a few extra herbs.

name: Fried meat pieces (No Tomato Sauce)
steps: Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the lamb and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes. Season with saffron, salt and pepper to taste; stir in all but 4 tablespoons of the onion, and pour in the water. Bring to the boil, then cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the lamb is tender, about 15 minutes.

Uncover the pan, stir in the butter and allow the sauce reduce 5 to 10 minutes to desired consistency. Season to taste with salt and pepper, then pour into a serving dish. Sprinkle with the remaining chopped onions and parsley. Garnish with lemon wedges to serve.

name: Kentucky Fried Chicken
steps: Preheat fryer to 350Â°F. Thoroughly mix together all the spice mix ingredients.
Combine spice mix with flour, brown sugar and salt.
Dip chicken pieces in egg white to lightly coat them, then transfer to flour mixture. Turn a few times and make sure the flour mix is really stuck to the chicken. Repeat with all the chicken pieces.
Let chicken pieces rest for 5 minutes so crust has a chance to dry a bit.

Fry chicken in batches. Breasts and wings should take 12-14 minutes, and legs and thighs will need a few more minutes. Chicken pieces are done when a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part reads 165Â°F.
Let chicken drain on a few paper towels when it comes out of the fryer. Serve hot.

name: Kenyan Beef Curry
steps: Bring the 4 cups of water to a boil in a Dutch oven or soup pot. Add the beef, garlic, and ginger, and stir well. Bring to a gentle simmer, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes. If you get any foamy scum on the top, not to worry, simply spoon it away or stir it back in.
Remove from the heat, and drain, but reserve the excess water for later.
Return the pot or Dutch oven to medium heat with the 2 tablespoons of cooking oil. Once the oil is shimmering, add the onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add the tomatoes to the onions, and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are falling apart, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add the drained beef to the tomato and onion mixture, and stir well. Continue cooking over medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the paprika, pepper, curry powder, tomato paste, and salt to taste, and stir well.

Add back the excess water that was used for cooking the beef, along with enough extra water to cover. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for about 1 hour, or until the meat is tender and the sauce is thickened. Add additional water if your beef curry begins to dry and stick, or if would like your curry to have more of a soupy consistency.
When the beef curry is ready, remove from the heat, give it a taste, and adjust the seasonings as desired. Garnish with fresh chilis and cilantro.

name: Key Lime Pie
steps: Heat the oven to 160C/fan 140C/gas 3. Whizz the biscuits to crumbs in a food processor (or put in a strong plastic bag and bash with a rolling pin). Mix with the melted butter and press into the base and up the sides of a 22cm loose-based tart tin. Bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove and cool.

Put the egg yolks in a large bowl and whisk for a minute with electric beaters. Add the condensed milk and whisk for 3 minutes then add the zest and juice and whisk again for 3 minutes. Pour the filling into the cooled base then put back in the oven for 15 minutes. Cool then chill for at least 3 hours or overnight if you like.

When you are ready to serve, carefully remove the pie from the tin and put on a serving plate. To decorate, softly whip together the cream and icing sugar. Dollop or pipe the cream onto the top of the pie and finish with extra lime zest.

name: Khobz el Dar (Algerian Semolina Bread)
steps: Mix 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons semolina, 2 tablespoons sesame seeds, sugar, yeast, and salt together in a large bowl. Whisk in oil, egg, and egg white. Stir in warm milk slowly until a liquid dough forms.
Cover the bowl with a plate or plastic wrap; let stand at room temperature until frothy, about 1 hour.
Stir in 2 3/4 cups flour with a wooden spoon until a sticky dough forms. Cover again and allow to rest for 30 minutes.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a baking mat.

Sprinkle 1 tablespoon flour over the dough and your hands. Mix dough, adding flour as needed, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it pulls away from the sides of the bowl. Shape into a round loaf and place on the prepared baking sheet. Cover loosely with a towel and let rise for 1 hour in a warm place until loaf doubles in volume.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Beat egg yolk and water in a bowl with a fork; brush over the entire surface of the loaf. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon sesame seeds on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until loaf is golden brown, about 20 to 25 minutes.

name: Kidney Bean Curry
steps: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a low-medium heat. Add the onion and a pinch of salt and cook slowly, stirring occasionally, until softened and just starting to colour. Add the garlic, ginger and coriander stalks and cook for a further 2 mins, until fragrant.
Add the spices to the pan and cook for another 1 min, by which point everything should smell aromatic. Tip in the chopped tomatoes and kidney beans in their water, then bring to the boil.
Turn down the heat and simmer for 15 mins until the curry is nice and thick. Season to taste, then serve with the basmati rice and the coriander leaves.

name: Knafeh
steps: Take kanfhe in a bowl and roughly cut them. Pour melted butter, yellow food color and mix well with your hands.
In a separate bowl mix milk, cream cheese, sugar, cornstarch well.
Turn on the flame and boil the liquid, when it gets thick turn off the flame let it cool down a little bit.
Add mozzarella in it and mix it well.
Now make a base with half of the kanfhe in a dish, gently press it to level the dough well.
Pour the cheese mixture on the top and level it with a spoon.
Cover it with the other half of the kanfhe.
Put the dish in a preheated oven at 200 degree for about 20-25 minutes.
It's ready when kunafa is golden and crunchy in the surface.
Boil water in a pan and dissolve sugar in it for 4â5 minutes. OR cook it until slightly thicken and keep on stirring. Add lemon juice with rose water, mix well.
Evenly pour the syrup over the kunafa as soon as it comes out of the oven.
Your kunafa is ready to serve.

name: kofta burgers
steps: step 1

Tip the mince into a large bowl (use a clean washing-up bowl if you donât have anything big enough) with all the other burger ingredients and a good pinch of salt. Roll up your sleeves, get your hands into the mix and squelch everything together through your fingers until completely mixed. Pat the mix into 16 small burgers. These may now be frozen for up to 1 month or chilled up to a day ahead.
step 2

To cook, heat grill to its highest setting and lay the burgers in a single layer on a baking tray (you may need to do this in batches, depending on how big your tray is). Grill on the highest shelf for 5-6 mins on each side until browned and cooked through. Pile burgers onto a platter and serve with all the accompaniments, so everyone can construct their own sandwich.

name: Koshari
steps: Cook the lentils. Bring lentils and 4 cups of water to a boil in a medium pot or saucepan over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook until lentils are just tender (15-17 minutes). Drain from water and season with a little salt. (Note: when the lentils are ready, they should not be fully cooked. They should be only par-cooked and still have a bite to them as they need to finish cooking with the rice).

Now, for the rice. Drain the rice from its soaking water. Combine the par-cooked lentils and the rice in the saucepan over medium-high heat with 1 tbsp cooking oil, salt, pepper, and coriander. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring regularly. Add warm water to cover the rice and lentil mixture by about 1 1/2 inches (youâll probably use about 3 cups of water here). Bring to a boil; the water should reduce a bit. Now cover and cook until all the liquid has been absorbed and both the rice and lentils are well cooked through (about 20 minutes).  Keep covered and undisturbed for 5 minutes or so.

Now make the pasta. While the rice and lentils are cooking, make the pasta according to package instructions by adding the elbow pasta to boiling water with a dash of salt and a little oil. Cook until the pasta is al dente. Drain.
Cover the chickpeas and warm in the microwave briefly before serving.
Make the crispy onion topping.
Sprinkle the onion rings with salt, then toss them in the flour to coat. Shake off excess flour.
In a large skillet, heat the cooking oil over medium-high heat, cook the onion rings, stirring often, until they turn a nice caramelized brown. Onions must be crispy, but not burned (15-20 minutes).

name: Krispy Kreme Donut
steps: Dissolve yeast in warm water in 2 1/2-quart bowl. Add milk, sugar, salt, eggs, shortening and 2 cups flour. Beat on low for 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. Stir in remaining flour until smooth. Cover and let rise until double, 50-60 minutes. (Dough is ready when indentation remains when touched.) Turn dough onto floured surface; roll around lightly to coat with flour. Gently roll dough 1/2-inch thick with floured rolling pin. Cut with floured doughnut cutter. Cover and let rise until double, 30-40 minutes.

Heat vegetable oil in deep fryer to 350Â°. Slide doughnuts into hot oil with wide spatula. Turn doughnuts as they rise to the surface. Fry until golden brown, about 1 minute on each side. Remove carefully from oil (do not prick surface); drain. Dip the doughnuts into creamy glaze set on rack.
Glaze:
Heat butter until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth. Stir in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency.

name: Kumpir
steps: If you order kumpir in Turkey, the standard filling is first, lots of butter mashed into the potato, followed by cheese. Thereâs then a row of other toppings that you can just point at to your heartâs content â sweetcorn, olives, salami, coleslaw, Russian salad, allsorts â and you walk away with an over-stuffed potato because you got ever-excited by the choices on offer.
Grate (roughly â you can use as much as you like) 150g of cheese.
Finely chop one onion and one sweet red pepper.
Put these ingredients into a large bowl with a good sprinkling of salt and pepper, chilli flakes (optional).

name: Kung Pao Chicken
steps: Combine the sake or rice wine, soy sauce, sesame oil and cornflour dissolved in water. Divide mixture in half.
In a glass dish or bowl, combine half of the sake mixture with the chicken pieces and toss to coat. Cover dish and place in refrigerator for about 30 minutes.

In a medium frying pan, combine remaining sake mixture, chillies, vinegar and sugar. Mix together and add spring onion, garlic, water chestnuts and peanuts. Heat sauce slowly over medium heat until aromatic.
Meanwhile, remove chicken from marinade and sautÃ© in a large frying pan until juices run clear. When sauce is aromatic, add sautÃ©ed chicken and let simmer together until sauce thickens.

name: Kung Po Prawns
steps: Mix the cornflour and 1 tbsp soy sauce, toss in the prawns and set aside for 10 mins. Stir the vinegar, remaining soy sauce, tomato purÃ©e, sugar and 2 tbsp water together to make a sauce.
When youâre ready to cook, heat a large frying pan or wok until very hot, then add 1 tbsp oil. Fry the prawns until they are golden in places and have opened outâ then tip them out of the pan.

Heat the remaining oil and add the peanuts, chillies and water chestnuts. Stir-fry for 2 mins or until the peanuts start to colour, then add the ginger and garlic and fry for 1 more min. Tip in the prawns and sauce and simmer for 2 mins until thickened slightly. Serve with rice.

name: KvÃ¦fjord Cake âVerdens Besteâ (Worldâs Best Cake)
steps: Vanilla custard
Separate the egg yolks and set aside the whites to use in the meringue.
Whisk together the egg yolks, cornstarch and sugar in a bowl.

Heat the cream and milk in a saucepan. Split open the vanilla pod and add the beans to the saucepan. Once the milk begins to bubble pour about half of it into the bowl with the egg mixture, whisking constantly. Then return the saucepan to the heat and pour the egg mixture back into the saucepan with remaining milk, whisking constantly. Once the mixture thickens lower the heat and continue whisking for about 30 seconds.
Pour the custard into a clean bowl and cover with plastic wrap, placing the plastic directly on the top layer of the custard. Chill in the fridge.
Cake

Mix together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg yolks one at a time, setting aside the egg whites for the meringue. Add the flour mixed with baking powder. Stir in the milk, beating until smooth (you can use an electric mixer if you prefer).
Preheat oven to 320Â°F (160Â°C). Cover a baking sheet with baking paper and spread out the batter into a large, even rectangle.
Meringue topping
Whisk together the egg whites and sugar until you get glossy, stiff peaks. The meringue should hold its form â if it still melts continue whisking.

Spread out the meringue on top of the cake batter. Use a spatula to form light waves with the meringue. Sprinkle almonds on top of the meringue. Bake for about 30 minutes, until the meringue and almonds are golden.
Cream filling
Whisk the cream into stiff peaks. Carefully fold in the vanilla custard.
Assembly
Once the cake has cooled, cut it in half. You can use scissors for this, or a knife on a cutting board, slicing through the baking paper as well.
Place half of the cake on a serving platter with the meringue side down and peel off the baking paper.
Spread the cream filling across the cake. Then carefully remove the other half of the cake from the baking paper and place it over the cream filling, meringue side up.
Serve with fresh berries.

name: Jam Roly-Poly
steps: Mix flour and suet.
Add milk to form a dough.
Roll out dough and spread jam.
Roll into a log and wrap.
Steam until cooked through.
Sprinkle with sugar before serving.

name: Japanese Curry
steps: Fry onions and chicken.
Add vegetables and water.
Simmer until tender.
Add curry roux and dissolve.
Simmer briefly before serving.

name: Japanese Gohan
steps: Rinse rice until water runs clear.
Cook with equal parts water.
Steam for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Japanese Gyoza
steps: Mix pork, cabbage, garlic, ginger, soy sauce and sesame oil.
Place filling in wrappers and fold.
Fry until bottoms are crisp.
Add water and steam until cooked.

name: Japanese Miso Soup
steps: Heat dashi stock.
Add tofu and wakame.
Stir in miso paste off the heat.
Serve with spring onions.

name: Japanese Salted Salmon
steps: Salt salmon fillets.
Leave 1 hour to cure.
Grill until cooked.

name: Japanese Sushi
steps: Prepare sushi rice with vinegar.
Lay nori and spread rice.
Add fillings and roll.
Slice and serve.

name: Japanese Tempura
steps: Make light batter with flour, egg and ice water.
Dip ingredients into batter.
Deep fry until crisp.

name: Japanese Vegetable Curry
steps: Fry onion.
Add vegetables and water.
Simmer until tender.
Stir in curry roux and cook briefly.

name: Jelly
steps: Dissolve gelatin in hot juice.
Add sugar and stir.
Chill until set.

name: Jeera Rice
steps: Heat butter and fry cumin seeds.
Add soaked rice and water.
Cook until rice is fluffy.

name: Jhal Frezi
steps: Stir-fry onions, garlic and ginger.
Add chicken and cook.
Add vegetables and spices.
Cook until everything is tender.

name: Jibarito
steps: Slice plantains lengthwise and fry.
Flatten and refry until crisp.
Cook steak and season.
Assemble with mayo, lettuce and tomato.

name: Jollof Rice
steps: Blend tomatoes, peppers and onion.
Fry mixture with tomato paste.
Add rice and water.
Cook until rice is tender.

name: Jota
steps: Cook beans until tender.
Fry onions and garlic.
Add beans, sauerkraut and potatoes.
Simmer until flavours combine.

name: Imam bayildi with BBQ lamb
steps: Slice aubergines lengthways and shallow-fry until golden.
Cook onions and garlic in oil.
Add tomatoes, paprika, salt and pepper.
Stuff aubergines with the mixture.
Grill lamb fillets and serve with the stuffed aubergines.

name: Indian Chicken Curry
steps: Fry onions until golden.
Add garlic and ginger paste.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Add tomatoes, yogurt and spices.
Simmer until chicken is tender.

name: Indian Salad
steps: Mix all chopped vegetables.
Add lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Toss and garnish with coriander.

name: Iranian Rice
steps: Soak rice for 30 minutes.
Parboil and drain.
Melt butter with turmeric.
Steam rice until fluffy with a crispy tahdig.

name: Italian Bread Salad (Panzanella)
steps: Soak bread briefly in water and squeeze.
Chop vegetables and mix with bread.
Add oil, vinegar, salt, pepper.
Toss well and chill before serving.

name: Italian Meatballs
steps: Mix meats, breadcrumbs, parmesan, garlic, parsley and egg.
Form meatballs.
Fry until browned.
Simmer in tomato sauce until cooked.

name: Italian Pasta Salad
steps: Cook pasta and cool.
Mix with tomatoes, olives and mozzarella.
Add oil, vinegar, salt and pepper.
Toss and serve chilled.

name: Italian Pizza Dough
steps: Mix flour and salt.
Add yeast to warm water.
Combine and knead into dough.
Rise 1 hour, then shape.

name: Italian Spaghetti Arrabiata
steps: Cook spaghetti until al dente.
SautÃ© garlic and chilli in oil.
Add tomatoes and simmer.
Mix with pasta and serve.

name: Italian Style Broccoli
steps: Steam broccoli.
Fry garlic in oil.
Toss broccoli with garlic oil.
Season with salt and pepper.

name: Italian Style Hot Dogs
steps: Cook hot dogs.
SautÃ© peppers and onions.
Assemble in buns and serve.

name: Ham Croquetas
steps: Melt butter in a pan and stir in flour to form a roux.
Gradually whisk in milk until thick and smooth.
Add chopped ham, nutmeg, salt and pepper.
Cool mixture completely, then shape into croquetas.
Dip in flour, beaten egg, and breadcrumbs.
Deep-fry until golden.

name: Ham hock colcannon
steps: Boil the ham hock until tender. Shred the meat.
Boil potatoes and mash with butter and milk.
Cook cabbage, then mix into the potatoes.
Stir in shredded ham and season.

name: Harira
steps: Fry onion, lamb and celery.
Add tomatoes, chickpeas, lentils and spices.
Cover with water and simmer until tender.
Stir in flour paste to thicken.
Add herbs before serving.

name: Hash
steps: Dice potatoes and fry until browned.
Add onion and cook until soft.
Stir in corned beef and fry until crisp.

name: Hawaiian Pizza
steps: Spread tomato sauce on dough.
Top with ham, pineapple and cheese.
Bake until crust is golden.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices.
Fry onions until crisp.
Layer chicken, rice, herbs and fried onions.
Cook on low heat until done.

name: Honeycake (Medovik)
steps: Mix honey, sugar and eggs over heat until smooth.
Stir in flour and knead dough.
Roll thin layers and bake.
Stack with cream filling.

name: Honey Teriyaki Salmon
steps: Mix soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger and sesame oil.
Marinate salmon for 20 minutes.
Pan-fry or grill until cooked through.
Brush with extra marinade while cooking.

name: Honey Ginger Tofu
steps: Cube tofu and coat in cornflour.
Fry until crisp and set aside.
Mix soy sauce, honey, garlic and ginger.
Toss tofu in sauce and serve.

name: Hot and Sour Soup
steps: Heat stock, add mushrooms and tofu.
Add soy sauce, vinegar and chilli paste.
Thicken with cornflour paste.
Add spring onions before serving.

name: Houmous
steps: Blend chickpeas, tahini, garlic and lemon juice.
Add oil and blend until smooth.
Adjust salt and consistency.

name: Hungarian Goulash
steps: SautÃ© onions and garlic.
Add beef and brown well.
Stir in paprika and tomato paste.
Add vegetables and water.
Simmer until tender.

name: Hunterâs Chicken
steps: Season chicken and pan-fry lightly.
Wrap each piece in bacon.
Cover with barbecue sauce.
Top with cheddar and bake until cooked.

name: Hure
steps: Boil pork head meat with vegetables and spices.
Shred and pack into moulds.
Chill until set.

name: Hyderabadi Chicken Curry
steps: Fry onions until golden.
Add garlic and ginger paste.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Add tomatoes, yogurt and spices.
Simmer until chicken is tender.

name: Hyderabadi Khatti Daal
steps: Boil dal with turmeric until soft.
Mash lightly and add tamarind.
Temper oil with garlic, cumin and curry leaves.
Pour tempering over dal.
Simmer briefly and serve.

name: Hyderabadi Mutton Biryani
steps: Marinate mutton with yogurt, spices and paste.
Fry onions until crisp.
Layer mutton, rice, herbs and fried onions.
Cook on low heat until rice and meat are tender.

name: Hyderabadi Mutton Dalcha
steps: Cook dal until soft.
Fry onions and paste, add mutton and spices.
Add tomatoes and cook thoroughly.
Combine dal and meat, simmer until tender.

name: Hyderabadi Tahari
steps: Fry onions and spices.
Add vegetables and cook.
Add rice and water.
Cover and cook until rice is done.

name: Gambas al ajillo
steps: Peel the prawns, leaving the tails intact, and, using a coc...ook the prawns in their shells. Season with a little sea salt.
Put the garlic, olive oil and chillies in a flameproof terr... as the oil and terracotta will remain hot for several minutes.

name: Garides Saganaki
steps: Place the prawns in a pot and add enough water to cover. Boil for 5 minutes. Drain, reserving the liquid, and set aside.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a saucepan. Add the onion; coo...onally, for about 30 minutes, or until the sauce is thickened.
While the sauce is simmering, the prawns should become cool...m, and then pull off the shells, leaving the head and tail on.
When the sauce has thickened, stir in the prawns. Bring to ...cheese starts to melt. Serve warm with slices of crusty bread.
Though completely untraditional, you can add a few tablespo... pasta sauce. Toss with pasta after adding the feta, and serve.

name: Garlicky prawns with sherry
steps: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a medium-high heat ...turn pink. Add the sherry and bubble for 1 minute until syrupy.
Season to taste. Scatter with the parsley and serve with charred bread, if you like.

name: Ghormeh Sabzi
steps: Fry onions in oil until golden.
Add lamb and turmeric, cook until browned.
Add chopped herbs and fry until darkened.
Add beans, dried limes and water to cover.
Simmer until meat and beans are tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve with rice.

name: Giouvetsi
steps: Heat oil in a pot and brown the beef.
Add onions and garlic and cook until softened.
Stir in tomato puree and tomatoes.
Add cinnamon, bay leaf and enough water to cover.
Simmer until beef is tender.
Add orzo and cook until tender, adding more water if needed.

name: Gyros
steps: Marinate pork in oil, herbs, spices, garlic and lemon juice.
Grill or roast until cooked and slightly charred.
Slice the meat thinly.
Serve in warm pita with tomato, onion and tzatziki.

name: GÃ¶zleme
steps: Mix flour, water and salt into a soft dough.
Rest the dough, then divide and roll into thin circles.
Fill with spinach and feta, fold and seal.
Cook on a lightly oiled griddle until golden on both sides.

name: Gazpacho
steps: Soak bread in water and squeeze out excess.
Blend all vegetables, bread, oil, vinegar and salt until smooth.
Chill well before serving.
Serve cold with chopped vegetables as garnish if desired.

name: Grilled Portuguese sardines
steps: Clean the sardines and pat dry.
Mix oil, crushed garlic and salt, and rub over sardines.
Grill on a barbecue or griddle until cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Grilled Portuguese sardines (marinated)
steps: Put all of the ingredients, except the sardines, into a bow...ardines and toss really well. Cover and chill for a few hours.
Heat a BBQ or griddle pan until hot. Cook the sardines for ...e with a little more paprika and squeeze over the lemon wedges.

name: FainÃ¡
steps: Preheat your oven to 250Â°C (480Â°F) and place a baking pan (preferably cast iron or a pizza pan) inside to heat up.
In a large bowl, gradually whisk the water into the chickpe...il and 1 teaspoon of salt. Continue whisking until smooth.
Let the batter rest for at least 2 hours, or overnight in t...ensure the chickpea flour fully hydrates and the flavors meld.
For a crispy edge, preheat the baking pan with oil in the oven before adding the batter.

name: Falafel
steps: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large pan, then fry the onion and garl...Add the egg, then squish the mixture together with your hands.
Mould the mix into 6 balls, then flatten into patties. Heat...nd firm. Serve hot or cold with couscous, pitta bread or salad.

name: Falafel Pita Sandwich with Tahini Sauce
steps: Whisk together tahini, water, lemon juice, garlic, and salt until smooth.
Warm the pita breads and cut open to form pockets.
Stuff each pita with falafel, tomato, cucumber, and lettuce.
Drizzle with tahini sauce and serve.

name: Fettucine alfredo
steps: Cook the fettuccine in boiling salted water until al dente.
Melt butter in a pan, add cream and bring to a gentle simmer.
Stir in grated parmesan until melted and smooth.
Toss the drained pasta with the sauce.
Season with salt and black pepper and serve immediately.

name: Filo Pastry
steps: Mix flour and salt in a bowl.
Add olive oil and vinegar, then gradually add water.
Knead into a soft, elastic dough.
Divide into balls, cover, and rest.
Roll each ball into a thin sheet for use.

name: Fish pie
steps: Boil potatoes until tender, then mash with milk and butter.
Poach fish in milk, then flake into a baking dish with prawns.
Make a white sauce with butter, flour and milk.
Pour sauce over fish, top with mashed potato and cheese.
Bake until golden and bubbling.

name: Fish Soup
steps: Heat oil in a pot and sautÃ© onion, carrots and celery.
Add potatoes and fish, cover with water.
Simmer until vegetables and fish are cooked.
Season with salt, pepper and lemon juice.
Serve hot.

name: Francesinha
steps: Grill the steak and sausages.
Layer bread with ham, steak, sausage and cheese to make sandwiches.
Cover sandwiches with more cheese.
Pour hot tomato-beer sauce over the sandwiches.
Grill until cheese is melted and serve hot.

name: French Onion Soup
steps: Cook onions slowly in butter and oil until caramelised.
Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute.
Add wine and stock, simmer for 30 minutes.
Top toasted baguette slices with gruyere.
Float the bread on the soup and grill until cheese melts.

name: Fried Anchovies
steps: Clean and rinse the anchovies.
Season flour with salt and coat anchovies.
Fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towel and serve hot.

name: Fried Rice
steps: Heat oil in a wok, add garlic and onion and fry until fragrant.
Add vegetables and stir-fry until tender.
Push vegetables to the side, scramble eggs in the same pan.
Add rice and soy sauce, mix everything together.
Stir-fry until heated through and serve.

name: Frozen Peanut Butter Pie
steps: Mix crushed cookies with melted butter and press into a pie dish.
Beat peanut butter, cream cheese and icing sugar until smooth.
Fold in whipped cream and spoon into crust.
Freeze until firm before serving.

name: Fyrstekake (Norwegian Almond Cake)
steps: Crust
Stir together flour, sugar, and baking powder in a mixing bowl.
Cut the butter into the flour mixture in a food processor o...the butter is fully incorporated and the mixture clumps up.
Press the dough into a ball. If it feels too dry, you can a...urning the dough out onto a very lightly floured countertop
Pack the dough in plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Almond filling
Run the almonds and sugar together in a food processor unti...you can decide for yourself how coarse or fine you want them).
Stir in the butter, egg, cognac and/or almond extract (if using).
Assembly
Line the bottom of your cake form with baking paper and grease the sides of the form.
Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
Cut 2/3 of the crust dough into slices and press down into ...2-3 cm (1 inch) up the sides of the form, pressing until even.
Scoop the almond filling on top of the crust, spreading it evenly across the cake form.
Roll out of the rest of the dough and slice into long strip...he strips break â simply press them back together on the cake.
Gently brush the dough with egg wash.
Bake for about 45 minutes. The top of the cake should be golden brown while the almond filling will remain soft.

name: Easy Spanish chicken
steps: Heat oil in a large frying pan and fry the onion until softened.
Add chorizo and cook until it releases its oils.
Add red pepper and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add chicken thighs and brown on all sides.
Stir in paprika, passata, and chicken stock.
Season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot with rice or crusty bread.

name: Egg Curry
steps: Heat oil in a pan and sautÃ© onions until golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste and sautÃ© for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add spices and cook for 2 minutes.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Add boiled eggs and simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

name: Eggs benedict
steps: Toast the English muffins and spread with butter.
Top each muffin half with a slice of ham.
Poach the eggs in simmering water with vinegar.
Place a poached egg on each muffin half.
To make hollandaise, whisk egg yolks and lemon juice over a bain-marie.
Gradually add melted butter while whisking until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper and spoon over the eggs.
Serve immediately.

name: English Breakfast
steps: Grill sausages and bacon until cooked and browned.
Fry mushrooms and tomatoes in a pan with a little oil.
Heat baked beans in a small saucepan.
Fry or poach the eggs as desired.
Toast the bread and spread with butter.
Serve everything together on a large plate.

name: Eton Mess
steps: Hull and slice the strawberries.
Sprinkle with caster sugar and leave to macerate.
Whip the cream until soft peaks form.
Fold in the crushed meringue and most of the strawberries.
Spoon into serving glasses and top with remaining strawberries.
Serve immediately.

name: Eccles Cakes
steps: Make a pastry dough with butter, flour, and lemon juice.
Chill the dough in the fridge.
Mix currants, mixed peel, sugar, and spices for the filling.
Roll out the pastry and cut into circles.
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each circle.
Fold and seal, then bake until golden brown.
Serve warm or cold.

name: Dal fry
steps: Rinse the lentils in cold water. Add dal and water in a pot.
Add salt and turmeric. Bring to a boil and simmer until soft.
In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin and mustard seeds.
Add bay leaves, green chilies, and curry leaves.
Add onion and cook until golden brown.
Add chili powder, coriander powder, and tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes soften.
Add cooked dal and garam masala. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Dal makhani
steps: Soak lentils and kidney beans overnight.
Cook them in a pressure cooker with water and salt until soft.
In a pan, heat butter and oil.
Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies. SautÃ© for a minute.
Add onion and cook until golden brown.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add chili powder, garam masala, and cooked lentils.
Simmer on low heat for 30 minutes.
Stir in cream and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Dumpling stuffed with meat
steps: Make a dough with flour, water, egg, and salt.
Let the dough rest and roll it out thinly.
Cut circles and add a spoon of meat mixture in each.
Seal the dumplings and boil in salted water until cooked.
Serve hot with sour cream or butter.

name: Duck Confit
steps: Rub duck legs with salt, thyme, and garlic.
Marinate for at least 24 hours in the fridge.
Rinse off the salt and pat dry.
Submerge duck legs in melted duck fat in an ovenproof dish.
Cook at low temperature until very tender.
Store in fat or grill before serving.

name: Drunken noodles (pad kee mao)
steps: Cook rice noodles according to packet instructions and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok and fry garlic and chili until fragrant.
Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked.
Add vegetables and cook until tender-crisp.
Add fish sauce, oyster sauce, and soy sauce.
Add noodles and basil leaves, tossing everything together.
Serve hot.

name: Dhakani kheema
steps: Heat oil in a pan and sautÃ© onions until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger and sautÃ© for a minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add spices and cook until fragrant.
Add minced beef and cook until browned.
Add water and simmer until cooked through.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

name: Cabbage Soup (Shchi)
steps: Add the butter to a large Dutch oven or other heavy-duty pot over medium heat. When the butter has melted, add the onion and sautÃ© until translucent.
Add the cabbage, carrot, and celery. SautÃ© until the vegetables begin to soften, stirring frequently, about 3 minutes.
Add the bay leaf and vegetable stock and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, until the vegetables are crisp-tender, about 15 minutes.
Add the potatoes and bring it back to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Add the tomatoes (or undrained canned tomatoes) and bring the soup back to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Remove and discard the bay leaf from the pot.
Serve topped with fresh sour cream and fresh dill.

name: Cacik
steps: Put a sieve over a large bowl, line it with a thick sheet of non-dyed kitchen paper or a clean muslin cloth, and spoon in the yogurt. Cover with another sheet of kitchen paper and leave to strain in the fridge for a minimum of 12 hrs.

Add the lemon juice, most of the olive oil and the dried mint to a bowl and stir well for the dried mint to soften and soak up the juices. Mix in the strained yogurt, then pour away the strained yogurt liquid and leave that bowl to one side.

Halve the cucumber(s) lengthways and remove the seeds by running a teaspoon from the top to the bottom of the flesh, halve the cucumbers widthways to make them shorter and easier to handle, then coarsely grate each one into the bowl the yogurt was straining over. Using clean hands (or a clean muslin cloth), squeeze as much of the liquid out of the cucumber as possible.
Add the strained, grated cucumber, garlic and Â¾ tsp flaky salt to the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Garnish with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil and a sprinkling of dried mint.

name: Cajun spiced fish tacos
steps: Cooking in a cajun spice and cayenne pepper marinade makes this fish super succulent and flavoursome. Top with a zesty dressing and serve in a tortilla for a quick, fuss-free main that's delightfully summery.
On a large plate, mix the cajun spice and cayenne pepper with a little seasoning and use to coat the fish all over.

Heat a little oil in a frying pan, add in the fish and cook over a medium heat until golden. Reduce the heat and continue frying until the fish is cooked through, about 10 minutes. Cook in batches if you donât have enough room in the pan.
Meanwhile, prepare the dressing by combining all the ingredients with a little seasoning.

Soften the tortillas by heating in the microwave for 5-10 seconds. Pile high with the avocado, lettuce and spring onion, add a spoonful of salsa, top with large flakes of fish and drizzle over the dressing.

name: Callaloo Jamaican Style
steps: Cut leaves and soft stems from the kale branches, them soak in a bowl of cold water for about 5-10 minutes or until finish with prep.
Proceed to slicing the onions, mincing the garlic and dicing the tomatoes. Set aside
Remove kale from water cut in chunks.
Place bacon on saucepan and cook until crispy. Then add onions, garlic, thyme, stir for about a minute or more
Add tomatoes; scotch bonnet pepper, smoked paprika. SautÃ© for about 2-3 more minutes.
Finally add vegetable, salt, mix well, and steamed for about 6-8 minutes or until leaves are tender. Add a tiny bit of water as needed. Adjust seasonings and turn off the heat.

Using a sharp knife cut both ends off the plantain. This will make it easy to grab the skin of the plantains. Slit a shallow line down the long seam of the plantain; peel only as deep as the peel. Remove plantain peel by pulling it back.
Slice the plantain into medium size lengthwise slices and set aside.
Coat a large frying pan with cooking oil spray. Spray the tops of the plantains with a generous layer of oil spray and sprinkle with salt, freshly ground pepper.
Let the plantains "fry" on medium heat, shaking the frying pan to redistribute them every few minutes.
As the plantains brown, continue to add more cooking oil spray, salt and pepper (if needed) until they have reached the desired color and texture.
Remove and serve with kale

name: Canadian Butter Tarts
steps: Preheat the oven to fan 170C/ conventional 190C/gas 5. Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured surface so itâs slightly thinner than straight from the pack. Then cut out 18-20 rounds with a 7.5cm fluted cutter, re-rolling the trimmings. Use the rounds to line two deep 12-hole tart tins (not muffin tins). If you only have a regular-sized, 12-hole tart tin you will be able to make a few more slightly shallower tarts.

Beat the eggs in a large bowl and combine with the rest of the ingredients except the walnuts. Tip this mixture into a pan and stir continuously for 3-4 minutes until the butter melts, and the mixture bubbles and starts to thicken. It should be thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon. Donât overcook, and be sure to stir all the time as the mixture can easily burn. Remove from the heat and stir in the nuts.

Spoon the filling into the unbaked tart shells so itâs level with the pastry. Bake for 15-18 minutes until set and pale golden. Leave in the tin to cool for a few minutes before lifting out on to a wire rack. Serve warm or cold.

name: Carbonada Criolla
steps: Brown the "Beef": In a large pot, brown the beef cubes. Remove and set aside.
SautÃ© "Vegetables": In the same pot, cook the onion until translucent. Add carrots, potatoes, and pumpkin, cooking for a few minutes.
Simmer: Return the beef to the pot. Add broth and dried apricots. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 1-2 hours, until the beef is tender.
Serve: Enjoy hot, with a crusty piece of bread.
Pro "Tips":
Brown the beef in batches to ensure it gets a good sear, which adds depth to the stew's flavor.
Adding the fruits towards the end of cooking preserves their texture and adds a subtle sweetness to the dish.

name: Carrot Cake
steps: For the carrot cake, preheat the oven to 160C/325F/Gas 3. Grease and line a 26cm/10in springform cake tin.
Mix all of the ingredients for the carrot cake, except the carrots and walnuts, together in a bowl until well combined. Stir in the carrots and walnuts.

Spoon the mixture into the cake tin and bake for 1 hour 15 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Remove the cake from the oven and set aside to cool for 10 minutes, then carefully remove the cake from the tin and set aside to cool completely on a cooling rack.
Meanwhile, for the icing, beat the cream cheese, caster sugar and butter together in a bowl until fluffy. Spread the icing over the top of the cake with a palette knife.

name: Cashew Ghoriba Biscuits
steps: Preheat the oven at 180 C / Gas 4. Line a baking tray with greaseproof paper.
In a bowl, mix the cashews and icing sugar. Add the egg yolks and orange blossom water and mix to a smooth homogeneous paste.
Take lumps of the cashew paste and shape into small balls. Roll the balls in icing sugar and transfer to the baking tray. Push an almond in the centre of each ghribia.
Bake until the biscuits are lightly golden, about 20 minutes. Keep an eye on them, they burn quickly.

name: Cevapi Sausages
steps: Place the ground meat in a bowl. Chop the onion very finely and grate the garlic cloves. Add to the bowl. Add the chopped parsley, all sorts of paprika, baking soda, dried breadcrumbs, water, Vegeta, salt, and pepper.
Mix well with the hand mixer fitted with the dough hooks. Cover the bowl with cling film/ plastic foil and leave to rest for 1 or 2 hours in the refrigerator.

Take portions of the meat mixture, about 50-55 g/ 1.7-1.9 oz/ Â¼ cup portions, and form the cevapi. The rolls should be about as thick as your thumb and about 7-10 cm/ 3-4 inches long. I had 18 sausages. The recipe can be easily doubled.

Grill the cevapcici on the hot grill pan or on the barbecue for about 12-14 minutes, turning them several times in between, or until brown and cooked through. I checked by cutting one in the middle and then grilling the following batches for the same period of time.

Serve hot as suggested above. The cevapcici can be reheated in the oven at 180 degrees Celsius/ 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 10 minutes or until heated through. Check one, if it is not hot enough, give the sausages a few more minutes.

name: Chakchouka
steps: In a large cast iron skillet or sautÃ© pan with a lid, heat oil over medium high heat. Add the onion and sautÃ© for 2-3 minutes, until softened. Add the peppers and garlic, and sautÃ© for an additional 3-5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, cumin, paprika, salt, and chili powder. Mix well and bring the mixture to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium low and continue to simmer, uncovered, 10-15 minutes until the mixture has thickened to your desired consistency. (Taste the sauce at this point and adjust for salt and spice, as desired.) Using the back of a spoon, make four craters in the mixture, large enough to hold an egg. Crack one egg into each of the craters. Cover the skillet and simmer for 5-7 minutes, until the eggs have set. Serve immediately with crusty bread or pita.

name: Cheese Borek
steps: In a medium bowl, whisk together egg, parsley, garlic and crushed red pepper. Mix in Gouda and Emmentaler.

One sheet at a time, place phyllo dough on a flat surface and brush with about 1 tablespoon butter. Cut lengthwise into 4 strips. Place a rounded teaspoon of the egg mixture at one end of each strip. Fold corner of strip over the filling, forming a triangular fold. Continue folding the length of the strip in triangular folds to form a small stuffed triangle. Repeat with remaining phyllo dough.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly butter a large baking sheet.
Arrange stuffed phyllo triangles in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven 30 minutes, or until lightly browned. Serve warm

name: Chelsea Buns
steps: Sift the flour and salt into a large bowl. Make a well in the middle and add the yeast.
Meanwhile, warm the milk and butter in a saucepan until the butter melts and the mixture is lukewarm.
Add the milk mixture and egg to the flour mixture and stir until the contents of the bowl come together as a soft dough. (You may need to add a little extra flour.)
Tip the dough onto a generously floured work surface. Knead for five minutes, adding more flour if necessary, until the dough is smooth and elastic and no longer feels sticky.

Lightly oil a bowl with a little of the vegetable oil. Place the dough into the bowl and turn until it is covered in the oil. Cover the bowl with cling film and set aside in a warm place for one hour, or until the dough has doubled in size.
Lightly grease a baking tray.

For the filling, knock the dough back to its original size and turn out onto a lightly floured work surface. Roll the dough out into a rectangle 0.5cm/Â¼in thick. Brush all over with the melted butter, then sprinkle over the brown sugar, cinnamon and dried fruit.

Roll the dough up into a tight cylinder , cut ten 4cm/1Â½in slice and place them onto a lightly greased baking sheet, leaving a little space between each slice. Cover with a tea towel and set aside to rise for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 190C/375F/Gas 5.
Bake the buns in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown.
Meanwhile, for the glaze, heat the milk and sugar in a saucepan until boiling. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Remove the buns from the oven and brush with the glaze, then set aside to cool on a wire rack.

name: Baba Ghanoush
steps: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Pierce the skin of eggplants several times with the tip of a knife.

Place eggplants directly on grill. Turn frequently with tongs and cook until completely blackened and soft, 25 to 30 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cover tightly with aluminum foil and allow to cool, about 15 minutes.
When eggplants are cool enough to handle, split them in half and scoop out the flesh into a colander placed over a bowl. Drain 5 or 10 minutes.

Transfer eggplant to mixing bowl. Add crushed garlic and salt; mix vigorously with a fork until eggplant breaks down into a paste. Mix in lemon juice, tahini, olive oil, and cayenne pepper. Stir in yogurt.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until completely chilled. Stir in mint and parsley before serving.

name: Baked egg with tomato and chorizo hash
steps: Heat the oil in a medium-sized frying pan. Throw in the onion and fry over a medium heat until softened and lightly coloured.
Add the chorizo and fry until it starts to release its oils, then add the garlic and red pepper and continue to fry.
Add the tomatoes and paprika, season and simmer until the tomatoes reduce down to a thick sauce.
Make 4 wells in the mixture with the back of a large spoon and crack the eggs into them.

Cover the pan with a lid or large baking sheet if you donât have one, and cook until the whites have just set and the yolks are still a little runny. Scatter over the parsley and serve with chunks of crusty bread.

name: Baked mango cheesecake
steps: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line the base of a deep 20cm springform tin.
Crush the biscuits to crumbs, then mix in the butter. Press into the base of the tin and bake for 10 mins. Allow to cool slightly.
In a food processor, whizz the mango flesh to a pulp. In a large bowl, whisk the lime zest and juice, sugar and cornflour until smooth.
Whisk in the soft cheese, then the eggs, one at a time. Fold through half the mango pulp.
Pour the filling onto the cooled biscuit base, then drizzle over the remaining mango. Use a skewer to create a swirled effect.
Bake for 45 mins until set, then turn off the oven, prop the door ajar and leave the cheesecake to cool completely.
Chill for at least 3 hrs or overnight. Serve topped with the sliced mango.

name: Baked pork chops
steps: Preheat oven to 190 degrees C.
Place pork chops in a baking pan. Spread 1 teaspoon of butter over each chop, then spread 1 teaspoon of mayonnaise over butter.
Top with garlic, seasoning salt and pepper. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of paprika onto each chop.
Bake 35 minutes in preheated oven, or until the internal temperature of the chops has reached 63 degrees C.

name: Baked salmon with fennel & tomatoes
steps: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Chop the fennel into wedges and thinly slice the onion.
Toss the fennel and onion together with 2 tbsp olive oil in a roasting tin. Season and roast for 20 mins.
Zest the lemon and cut into wedges. Toss the fennel and onion with the lemon zest and cherry tomatoes. Dot over the butter.
Place the salmon on top of the vegetables, season, then drizzle with 1 tbsp olive oil.
Return to the oven for 12-15 mins until the salmon is just cooked. Scatter over the olives and basil, then serve with lemon wedges.

name: Baked stuffed peppers
steps: Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6.
Halve the peppers from top to bottom and remove the seeds. Put in a roasting tin, cut-side up, drizzle with 2 tbsp of the oil and season. Roast for 20 mins.
Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a frying pan, add onion and fry for 5 mins.
Add garlic and courgettes, then fry for 5 mins more. Stir in halved tomatoes and cook for another 3 mins.
Remove from the heat, stir in basil, breadcrumbs and half the Parmesan, then season.
Fill the pepper halves with the mixture, sprinkle over remaining Parmesan and return to the oven for 20 mins.

name: BBQ Beef Brisket
steps: Mix the sugar and spices together, then rub all over the beef brisket.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hrs or overnight.
Heat oven to 140C/120C fan/gas 1. Put the beef in a roasting tin and cover with foil.
Cook for 5 hrs until the meat is very tender. Slice and serve with BBQ sauce.

name: BBQ Chicken
steps: Mix the BBQ sauce, oil and spices in a bowl.
Slash the chicken legs a few times, then toss in the marinade. Leave for 1 hr or overnight.
Heat a barbecue or grill.
Cook the chicken for 20-25 mins, turning occasionally, until cooked through and charred.

name: BBQ Pork Sloppy Joes
steps: Heat a frying pan and cook the pork mince until browned.
Add the chopped onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Stir in the BBQ sauce, ketchup and mustard and simmer for 10 mins.
Serve in toasted burger buns.

name: Beef and Mustard Pie
steps: Brown the beef in a large pan.
Add the onion and carrots and cook for a few mins.
Pour in the stock and simmer until the beef is tender.
Stir in the mustard and cool the mixture.
Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Fill a pie dish with the beef mixture and cover with pastry.
Bake for 30-35 mins until golden.

name: Beef and Ox Cheek Pudding
steps: Brown the beef and ox cheek in a pan.
Add the onion and carrots and cook briefly.
Add the stock and simmer until the meat is tender.
Line a pudding basin with suet pastry, fill with the meat mixture and cover with more pastry.
Steam for 3-4 hrs until cooked through.

name: Beef Asado
steps: Marinate the beef in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves and pepper for at least 1 hr.
Brown the beef in a pan, then pour in the marinade.
Simmer until the beef is tender.

name: Beef Banh Mi Bowls with Sriracha Mayo
steps: Cook the rice according to pack instructions.
Pickle the carrots and cucumber in rice vinegar.
Fry the beef mince and season with soy sauce.
Mix the sriracha and mayonnaise.
Serve the beef over rice with the pickled vegetables and sriracha mayo.

name: Beef Bourguignon
steps: Marinate the beef in red wine overnight.
Brown the beef and bacon in a pan.
Add the onion, carrots and mushrooms and cook briefly.
Pour in the marinade and simmer until the beef is tender.

name: Beef Brisket Pot Roast
steps: Brown the brisket in a large pan.
Add the vegetables and cook briefly.
Pour in the stock and simmer until the beef is tender.

name: Beef Bulgogi
steps: Marinate the beef in soy sauce, sugar, garlic, sesame oil and spring onions.
Stir-fry in a hot pan until cooked through.

name: Beef Caldereta
steps: Brown the beef in a pan.
Add the potatoes and carrots and cook briefly.
Stir in the tomato sauce and liver spread and simmer until the beef is tender.

name: Beef Coconut Curry
steps: Fry the onion and pepper in a pan.
Add the curry paste and cook briefly.
Add the beef and brown.
Pour in the coconut milk and simmer until the beef is tender.

name: Beef Dumpling Stew
steps: Brown the beef in a pan.
Add the vegetables and stock and simmer until the beef is tender.
Add the dumplings and cook until they are done.

name: Beef Lo Mein
steps: Cook the noodles according to pack instructions.
Stir-fry the beef and vegetables in a hot pan.
Add the sauces and noodles and toss together.

name: Beef Roast
steps: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6.
Rub the beef with garlic, rosemary and olive oil.
Roast for 1-1.5 hrs depending on size and desired doneness.

name: Beef Salad
steps: Grill or fry the beef to your liking and slice.
Toss the salad ingredients together and top with the beef.
Dress with olive oil and lemon juice.

name: Beef Stew and Dumplings
steps: Brown the beef in a pan.
Add the vegetables and stock and simmer until the beef is tender.
Add the dumplings and cook until done.

name: Beef Tartare
steps: Finely chop the beef fillet.
Mix with the capers, gherkins, onion and parsley.
Serve topped with egg yolks.

name: Beef Wellington
steps: Brown the beef fillet in a pan.
Chop and fry the mushrooms until dry.
Wrap the beef in parma ham and mushrooms, then in puff pastry.
Brush with egg and bake at 200C/180C fan/gas 6 for 35-40 mins.

name: Beef Wet Burrito
steps: Cook the beef mince and season as desired.
Fill tortillas with beef, beans and some cheese.
Roll up and place in a baking dish.
Pour over salsa and top with remaining cheese.
Bake until hot and bubbling.

name: Beef Wontons
steps: Mix the beef mince with soy sauce, garlic and ginger.
Place small spoonfuls in wonton wrappers and seal.
Boil or steam until cooked through.

name: Beer Braised Brisket
steps: Brown the brisket in a pan.
Add the onion and garlic and cook briefly.
Pour in the beer and simmer until the beef is tender.

name: Beer Can Chicken
steps: Rub the chicken with spice rub.
Open the beer can and place it inside the chicken cavity.
Stand the chicken upright on a barbecue and cook until done.

name: Beetroot and Goats Cheese Salad
steps: Slice the beetroot and goats cheese.
Arrange on a bed of lettuce with walnuts.
Dress with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

name: Banana Bread
steps: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4.
Mash the bananas and mix with melted butter, sugar and egg.
Fold in the flour and pour into a loaf tin.
Bake for 40-45 mins.

name: BBQ Spareribs
steps: Preheat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3.
Brush the ribs with BBQ sauce and wrap in foil.
Bake for 2-3 hrs until tender.

name: Burek
steps: Fry the finely chopped onions and minced meat in oil. Add the salt and pepper.
Layer the filo pastry with the meat mixture and roll.
Bake at 200ÂºC/392ÂºF for half an hour and cut in quarters and serve.

name: Adana kebab
steps: step 1

Finely chop the peppers in a food processor, then tip them in a sieve and press into the sieve so that the peppers release all of their juices. Tip into a bowl along with the mince, red pepper paste, pul biber, 1Â½ tsp flaky sea salt, and 2 tbsp of the oil. Mix together, kneading well for at least 2-3 mins. If you need to, wet your hands with cold water to prevent the mixture from sticking. The mixture should be sticky when ready. Cover and chill for at least 2 hrs, or up to 12 hrs.
step 2

When ready to cook, heat the grill to high or an oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 6. Divide the mixture into 12 equal portions, around 85g each. If youâd like to skewer them, divide into 8 equal portions and roll into balls.
